channel.title: Why Isn't PRINT Invisible?
channel.description:
> Note: This pertinent question moved from a topic culled by curation. > > *(The topic was "should you be able to assign ~unset~ isotopes via SET-WORD! without getting an error, and the answer is obviously yes in light of new features...so the old conversation was just a jumble of outdated terminology which would confuse anyone finding it.)*
On a tangential note: I'm not sure why PRINT returns a ~none~ isotope, and wonder if it wouldn't be better to have it be silent like ELIDE? Would that create havoc if new users did confuse its usage?

item.title: Why Isn't PRINT Invisible?
item.dc:creator: hostilefork
item.description:
2 posts were merged into an existing topic: Why Isn't PRINT Invisible ("void")?

item.title: Why Isn't PRINT Invisible?
item.dc:creator: rgchris
item.description:
Note: This pertinent question moved from a topic culled by curation.

(The topic was "should you be able to assign ~unset~ isotopes via SET-WORD! without getting an error, and the answer is obviously yes in light of new features...so the old conversation was just a jumble of outdated terminology which would confuse anyone finding it.)

On a tangential note: I'm not sure why PRINT returns a ~none~ isotope, and wonder if it wouldn't be better to have it be silent like ELIDE? Would that create havoc if new users did confuse its usage?

Read full topic
